# NISession

**Class**

An object that identifies a unique connection between two peer devices.

## Declaration

```swift
class NISession
```

## Overview

This class represents the central mechanism to interact with nearby objects, for example, a peer Apple device or third-party accessory. After creating an [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISession] for a nearby object, the app interacts with the object by receiving [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate] callbacks.

One session represents an interaction between the user and a single nearby object. To interact with multiple nearby objects, create a separate session for each.

For more information, see [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/initiating-and-maintaining-a-session].

## Ensuring feature support

- **deviceCapabilities**: An object that communicates the device’s supported framework features.
- **NIDeviceCapability**: An interface that adds Boolean values that indicate an interaction session feature support.

## Connecting to A Peer Device

- **discoveryToken**: A temporary, random identifier for a device.
- **NIDiscoveryToken**: An object that uniquely identifies a peer that participates in an interaction session.
- **run(_:)**: Starts a session with a nearby peer.
- **configuration**: The configuration run by the session.
- **delegateQueue**: The dispatch queue on which the session invokes delegate callbacks.

## Managing life cycle

- **delegate**: An object that the framework notifies of session events.
- **pause()**: Stops sending distance and direction updates to the peer.
- **invalidate()**: Stops a running session.

## Utilizing Camera Assistance

- **setARSession(_:)**: Provides the framework with an existing AR session to use for Camera Assistance.
- **worldTransform(for:)**: Returns a world transform to integrate a nearby object in an AR experience.

## Deprecated

- **isSupported**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the device supports basic interaction-session functionality.

## Setup

- **Initiating and maintaining a session**: Measure the relative position of a nearby device and coach the user to sustain interaction.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
